alert.note: Alert for Eastern Franklin; Northern Worcester; Western Franklin (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 4:20PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Worcester and east central Franklin Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 420 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Montague, or near Greenfield, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and small hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Little to no impact from hail is expected. Locations impacted include... Greenfield, Orange, Deerfield, Gardner, Athol, Winchendon, Montague, Templeton, Rutland, Westminster, Ashburnham, Barre, Hubbardston, Sunderland, Princeton, Northfield, Hardwick, Oakham, Conway and Leverett. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. This storm may intensify and become severe. Stay tuned to your local media for updates and possible warnings. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for western and central Massachusetts.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Franklin; Northern Worcester; Western Franklin
